ShortDescription: Water tower built for Ammunition Plant No. 3
LocationDescription: Originally an industrial water tower built in 1937-1939 for the needs of Ammunition Factory No. 3 (within the Central Industrial District). The construction of a deep water intake (still active today) and a water tower was one of the first activities in Dęba (now Nowa Dęba). After the war, it also served the newly established city.

In the years 1937-39 in Nowa Dęba (then Dęba), within the Central Industrial District (COP), Ammunition Factory No. 3 was established. Therefore, the so-called White Villa was built in 1937. It was intended for Lt. Col. Jan Szypowski , the first manager of the ammunition factory.
 After the war, employees of Zakłady Metalowe lived there. Later, it was transformed into a school, and today it is a school common room. 

Already during the occupation, it was called "Paulusówka", because it is said that Field Marshal Friedrich von Paulus visited it in connection with German exercises at the Nowy Dęba training ground before Operation Barbarossa and the Stalingrad campaign. Historical research does not confirm this information.

ShortDescription: Facility for the Plant's employees and residents
LocationDescription: The outdoor swimming pool complex in Nowa Dęba consists of two basins: a swimming pool with dimensions of 50 m x 20 m and a depth of 1.20 m to 3 m. The pool was built in the 1930s and was modernized only once, in the 1970s, when the walls of the pool were repaired and the bottom was lined with ceramic tiles. At that time, changing rooms, toilets and a building with lifeguard rooms, a tennis storage room and a chlorination room were built. The pool operated in this condition until 2017,

ShortDescription: parish of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross
LocationDescription: The parish of the Exaltation of the Holy Cross was established in 1985 from the division of the parish of Our Lady Queen of Poland existing in Nowa Dęba. The history of this parish is closely related to the history of the entire town of Nowa Dęba, the creation and development of which was a consequence of the development of this area of the industrial center (from the establishment of the Ammunition Factory No. 3 as part of the COP in 1939, through Zakłady Metalowe DEZAMET, which in its best years employed over 5,000 people). Until 1957, Dęba was a branch of the Majdan Królewski parish (name "New Dęba appeared only in 1961, when the town received city rights. In the years 1947 to 1951, services were held in the premises provided by the DEZAMET management within the estate, and after the consent was withdrawn. It was then that the construction of a wooden chapel began, which - despite many efforts of the authorities who considered the construction illegal - survived as the seat of the parish of Our Lady Queen of Poland until the end of the 1990s. Many years of effort by the then parish priest, Fr. Prelate Henryk Łagocki (d. October 28, 1984) to obtain permission to build a new temple, as well as to designate a place for its location, were crowned with success only in the early 1980s. In July 1982 on the "hill" the construction of the church began. Exaltation of the Holy Cross, and in 1985 a new parish was established, the parish priest of which was Fr. Eugeniusz Nycz.

ShortDescription: Built in the early years of the city's development
